title: (x) Christiane Rochefort "Les petits enfants du siècle" book cover - Baskerville BQ {Lex}
content:
I came across this font on a book in French (Les petits enfants du siècle, by Christiane Rochefort - quite a good read) and I’ve been trying to figure out what font the cover’s done in. It looks familiar but I can’t quite put my finger on it.

Thanks in advance for any help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lespetitsenfants.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071211191045/http:/typophile.com/files/lespetitsenfants.jpg) | 114.86 KB |

 [‹ (x) "phard" logo extra bold script - Eclat {Lari, Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071211191045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30342 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) M & T Bank logo - ITC Bookman {Lari} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071211191045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30355 "Go to next forum topic")
author: copperfont

comments.content: Whoops... the ’insert image’ function didn’t work. Let me try uploading it again...

Possibly a Caslon of some sort.

- Lex

Hmm... it might actually be one of the Baskervilles with the single-serif ’C’. I’ll check in a second.

- Lex
